Name: Baumgartner, Michael
text:
1. I‚Äôve been involved with the challenges of Middle East for nearly 30 yrs. Donald Trump‚Äôs handling of Iran has been a masterclass in Presidential Leadership of historic proportions. Not only has the nuclear threat of a messianic regime been significantly diminished, new opportunities for regional peace have been opened. (I say this even if fighting resumes with assorted splinter factions of the Iranian IRCG). From Sulamani, to the Abraham Accords to the nuke lab strike, President Trump has displayed bold, strategic and region changing leadership. 
2. While I‚Äôm cautiously optimistic about the ceasefire due to the severe degradation of Iran‚Äôs military and terrorist proxies, the ongoing threat of virulent radical Islamic terrorism from significant elements should not be minimized in the days, months and years ahead. We must maintain vigilance and capability for this threat,
3. The 3 keys to the recent success have been A)Israeli ingenuity, B) American resolve and C) Increased US domestic energy production which has given us increased flexibility in dealing with the region and made us not only wealthier but also safer.
4. Perhaps the biggest impact of the ‚Äú12 Day War‚Äù (if that‚Äôs what we are calling it?) may be its potential impact to reduce the chance of war on Taiwan/Korea & China/N. Korea if the correct lessons are learned.

In the face of this heartbreak, we witnessed extraordinary bravery and compassion as our first responders risked their lives in the rescue efforts, and people across Florida and around the world came together to provide support, particularly within our Jewish community. Their strength and unity showed the true meaning of being Surfside Strong. Today, we pause to remember each life lost and stand with the families who continue to mourn. With this resolution, we honor their memory and recommit ourselves to never forgetting the legacy of those we lost.

I understand how the loss of childcare can be devastating for families, businesses, and whole communities, and I am committed to doing everything I can to find solutions at the federal level. 
I introduced the Investing in Rural America Act to encourage private investment in our rural communities for things like childcare and community centers. And the One Big Beautiful Bill increases the child tax credits and prevents the biggest tax hike in history, easing some of the burdens on America's families.

It was powerful to join the 53rd annual Juneteenth Oregon festival this weekend‚Äîrain or shine. Juneteenth is a celebration of Black freedom and brilliance. It is also a call to action: to recommit ourselves to building a more equitable future.

In Oregon, that means reckoning with our painful, racist history. This state was founded on exclusion and oppression, there‚Äôs no question about it. But just as deeply rooted is the strength, brilliance, and perseverance of Black Oregonians who shape and strengthen our communities every day. Honoring Juneteenth means telling the truth, showing up, and doing the work‚Äîtogether.

Due to days of persistent flu-like symptoms, I notified House Leadership, including House Chief Deputy Whip Rep. Guy Reschenthaler, on Monday morning that I would likely have to miss votes this week. Throughout this period, I remained prepared to travel to Washington, D.C. should my presence be required for any critical votes.

House leadership knew for a fact that today‚Äôs partisan vote to impeach President Trump would not succeed. While I was absent for this vote solely due to health reasons, the official record will indicate that I would have voted to table this ridiculous motion. Name: Cuellar, Henry
text:
During today‚Äôs Appropriations Homeland Security markup, I spoke in support of my bipartisan amendment to expand access to H-2A and H-2B visas for agricultural and seasonal workers, including circus and carnival staff.

This is personal to me. My father came to this country as a migrant worker and built a better life for our family through hard, honest work.

By law, employers must first actively recruit American workers. But even with these efforts, seasonal employers in rural areas still struggle to fill roles due to the nature, timing, or location of the work.

This amendment helps strengthen our food supply, supports local economies, and protects full-time American jobs that depend on a reliable supplemental workforce.
